projectDesc.p: To the tune “Bodhisattva Barbarians”—"Sending off Shugu at West Lake"is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Bodhisattva Barbarians”—"Sending off Shugu at West Lake"
In the autumn wind, on the lake, the cold and sparing rain
Keeps the prefect when he is about to go.
Today, he is held back in vain;
Tomorrow, it will worry us to death.
The fair ones shed thousands of teardrops,
There is no need to frown;
the passersby will cry even more.
